info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 6 at 6:32AM EDT until June 6 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River at Newberry and Edwardsport
Mississinewa River near Ridgeville.
Wabash River at Lafayette.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
Wildcat Creek near Lafayette.
White River at Elliston.
.Rainfall amounts of two to four inches across central Indiana is producing minor flooding along area waterways in west-central Indiana. Flooding is ongoing along Wildcat Creek and the Mississinewa River with flooding along the Wabash and White expected to begin today. Additional rainfall of one to two inches is possible over the White River basin through Sunday.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Mississinewa River near Ridgeville.
* WHEN...Until this evening.
* IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, Water on the shoulder and edge of SR 1 south of the junction with SR 28 in western Randolph County.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM EDT Friday the stage was 11.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 AM EDT Friday was 11.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this evening by around 600 PM EDT /500 PM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING
